comment: The English Opening is known for leading to subtle positional struggles. As will be seen, this game is an exception.
Staking a claim to the center.
Planning to place the bishop on the diagonal.

moves: 1. c4 e5 2. g3 Nc6 3. Bg2 d6 4. Nc3 Be6
comment: By unprotecting the pawn on b7, this move makes it easier for White to play b4. First, however, White must guard his c pawn.
White's queenside attack is off to a fast start. The threat is b5 winnng the pawn on b7. After 6... Nxb4 7. Qb3 Black is in trouble.

moves: 1. c4 e5 2. g3 Nc6 3. Bg2 d6 4. Nc3 Be6 5. d3 g6 6. b4 Qd7 7. b5 Nd8
comment: Guarding the pawn on b7.

moves: 1. c4 e5 2. g3 Nc6 3. Bg2 d6 4. Nc3 Be6 5. d3 g6 6. b4 Qd7 7. b5 Nd8 8. Nf3 Bg7 9. Ng5 e4
comment: Threatening 10... Bxc3+. However, the move opens up the game which is to White's advantage since he has the better placed pieces.

moves: 1. c4 e5 2. g3 Nc6 3. Bg2 d6 4. Nc3 Be6 5. d3 g6 6. b4 Qd7 7. b5 Nd8 8. Nf3 Bg7 9. Ng5 e4 10. Bb2 exd3 11. Qxd3 a6 12. h4
comment: White begins an attack on the king.

moves: 1. c4 e5 2. g3 Nc6 3. Bg2 d6 4. Nc3 Be6 5. d3 g6 6. b4 Qd7 7. b5 Nd8 8. Nf3 Bg7 9. Ng5 e4 10. Bb2 exd3 11. Qxd3 a6 12. h4 axb5 13. cxb5 Ne7
comment: Black is preparing to castle; however, the kingside is almost as dangerous as the center.

moves: 1. c4 e5 2. g3 Nc6 3. Bg2 d6 4. Nc3 Be6 5. d3 g6 6. b4 Qd7 7. b5 Nd8 8. Nf3 Bg7 9. Ng5 e4 10. Bb2 exd3 11. Qxd3 a6 12. h4 axb5 13. cxb5 Ne7 14. Qd2
comment: White guards the bishop on b2 so that he threatens Nce4 taking control of f6.

moves: 1. c4 e5 2. g3 Nc6 3. Bg2 d6 4. Nc3 Be6 5. d3 g6 6. b4 Qd7 7. b5 Nd8 8. Nf3 Bg7 9. Ng5 e4 10. Bb2 exd3 11. Qxd3 a6 12. h4 axb5 13. cxb5 Ne7 14. Qd2 O-O 15. h5
comment: To remove the pawn protection from the king and open up the h file. The immediate threat is 16. hxg6 hxg6 17. Nh7 Re8 18. Ne4 and Black is in serious trouble.

moves: 1. c4 e5 2. g3 Nc6 3. Bg2 d6 4. Nc3 Be6 5. d3 g6 6. b4 Qd7 7. b5 Nd8 8. Nf3 Bg7 9. Ng5 e4 10. Bb2 exd3 11. Qxd3 a6 12. h4 axb5 13. cxb5 Ne7 14. Qd2 O-O 15. h5 gxh5 16. Rxh5 Bf5
comment: Guarding the pawn on h7.

moves: 1. c4 e5 2. g3 Nc6 3. Bg2 d6 4. Nc3 Be6 5. d3 g6 6. b4 Qd7 7. b5 Nd8 8. Nf3 Bg7 9. Ng5 e4 10. Bb2 exd3 11. Qxd3 a6 12. h4 axb5 13. cxb5 Ne7 14. Qd2 O-O 15. h5 gxh5 16. Rxh5 Bf5 17. Be4
comment: If 17... Bxe4 18. Ncxe4 h6 19. Nf6+ Bxf6 20. Bxf6 hxg5 21. Rh8#.

moves: 1. c4 e5 2. g3 Nc6 3. Bg2 d6 4. Nc3 Be6 5. d3 g6 6. b4 Qd7 7. b5 Nd8 8. Nf3 Bg7 9. Ng5 e4 10. Bb2 exd3 11. Qxd3 a6 12. h4 axb5 13. cxb5 Ne7 14. Qd2 O-O 15. h5 gxh5 16. Rxh5 Bf5 17. Be4 Bg6 18. Rxh7
comment: Black's bishop was his best defensive piece. Now the king cannot be defended.

moves: 1. c4 e5 2. g3 Nc6 3. Bg2 d6 4. Nc3 Be6 5. d3 g6 6. b4 Qd7 7. b5 Nd8 8. Nf3 Bg7 9. Ng5 e4 10. Bb2 exd3 11. Qxd3 a6 12. h4 axb5 13. cxb5 Ne7 14. Qd2 O-O 15. h5 gxh5 16. Rxh5 Bf5 17. Be4 Bg6 18. Rxh7 Bxh7 19. Bxh7+ Kh8 20. O-O-O
comment: The threat is to bring the rook over to h1 and then move the bishop from h7. If 20... Bxc3 then 21. Qxc3+ f6 22. Qxf6+ Rxf6 23. Bxf6#.

moves: 1. c4 e5 2. g3 Nc6 3. Bg2 d6 4. Nc3 Be6 5. d3 g6 6. b4 Qd7 7. b5 Nd8 8. Nf3 Bg7 9. Ng5 e4 10. Bb2 exd3 11. Qxd3 a6 12. h4 axb5 13. cxb5 Ne7 14. Qd2 O-O 15. h5 gxh5 16. Rxh5 Bf5 17. Be4 Bg6 18. Rxh7 Bxh7 19. Bxh7+ Kh8 20. O-O-O Ng8
comment: To be able to block the h file with Nh6.

moves: 1. c4 e5 2. g3 Nc6 3. Bg2 d6 4. Nc3 Be6 5. d3 g6 6. b4 Qd7 7. b5 Nd8 8. Nf3 Bg7 9. Ng5 e4 10. Bb2 exd3 11. Qxd3 a6 12. h4 axb5 13. cxb5 Ne7 14. Qd2 O-O 15. h5 gxh5 16. Rxh5 Bf5 17. Be4 Bg6 18. Rxh7 Bxh7 19. Bxh7+ Kh8 20. O-O-O Ng8 21. Rh1 Nh6 22. Nd5
comment: This move pins Black's bishop on g7 and therefore threatens 23. Rxh6

moves: 1. c4 e5 2. g3 Nc6 3. Bg2 d6 4. Nc3 Be6 5. d3 g6 6. b4 Qd7 7. b5 Nd8 8. Nf3 Bg7 9. Ng5 e4 10. Bb2 exd3 11. Qxd3 a6 12. h4 axb5 13. cxb5 Ne7 14. Qd2 O-O 15. h5 gxh5 16. Rxh5 Bf5 17. Be4 Bg6 18. Rxh7 Bxh7 19. Bxh7+ Kh8 20. O-O-O Ng8 21. Rh1 Nh6 22. Nd5 f6
comment: Breaking the pin.

moves: 1. c4 e5 2. g3 Nc6 3. Bg2 d6 4. Nc3 Be6 5. d3 g6 6. b4 Qd7 7. b5 Nd8 8. Nf3 Bg7 9. Ng5 e4 10. Bb2 exd3 11. Qxd3 a6 12. h4 axb5 13. cxb5 Ne7 14. Qd2 O-O 15. h5 gxh5 16. Rxh5 Bf5 17. Be4 Bg6 18. Rxh7 Bxh7 19. Bxh7+ Kh8 20. O-O-O Ng8 21. Rh1 Nh6 22. Nd5 f6 23. Ne4
comment: If 23... Kxh7 then 24. Nexf6+ Rxf6 25. Nxf6+ Bxf6 26. Qxh6+ Kg8 27. Qxf6 and Black is defenseless.

moves: 1. c4 e5 2. g3 Nc6 3. Bg2 d6 4. Nc3 Be6 5. d3 g6 6. b4 Qd7 7. b5 Nd8 8. Nf3 Bg7 9. Ng5 e4 10. Bb2 exd3 11. Qxd3 a6 12. h4 axb5 13. cxb5 Ne7 14. Qd2 O-O 15. h5 gxh5 16. Rxh5 Bf5 17. Be4 Bg6 18. Rxh7 Bxh7 19. Bxh7+ Kh8 20. O-O-O Ng8 21. Rh1 Nh6 22. Nd5 f6 23. Ne4 Rxa2 24. Rxh6 Bxh6 25. Qxh6
comment: Threatening 26. Qxf8+

moves: 1. c4 e5 2. g3 Nc6 3. Bg2 d6 4. Nc3 Be6 5. d3 g6 6. b4 Qd7 7. b5 Nd8 8. Nf3 Bg7 9. Ng5 e4 10. Bb2 exd3 11. Qxd3 a6 12. h4 axb5 13. cxb5 Ne7 14. Qd2 O-O 15. h5 gxh5 16. Rxh5 Bf5 17. Be4 Bg6 18. Rxh7 Bxh7 19. Bxh7+ Kh8 20. O-O-O Ng8 21. Rh1 Nh6 22. Nd5 f6 23. Ne4 Rxa2 24. Rxh6 Bxh6 25. Qxh6 Qg7 26. Qh4
comment: Black resigned. White threatens, among other things, 27. Bg6+ Kg8 27. Nexf6+ Rxf6 28. Nxf6+ Kf8 29. Nh7+ Kg8 30. Qxd8+ Qf8 31. Qxf8#. If Black tries 26... Qxh7 then 27. Bxf6+ Rxf6 (27... Kg8 28. Ne7+ wins the queen) 28. Qxf6+ Qg7 (28... Kg8 29. Ne7+) 29. Qxd8+ Qg8 (29... Kh7 30. Ndf6+ Kh6 31. Qe8 Qg6 32. Qh8+ Qh7 33. Qxh7#.) 30. Qxg8+ Kxg8 31. Nec3 with an easily won end game.
